title: Fosun offers to invest up to $350 million in India's Fortis Healthcare
text:
April 17, 2018 / 6:42 PM / Updated 31 minutes ago Fosun offers to invest up to $350 million in India's Fortis Healthcare Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
(Reuters) - India’s Fortis Healthcare Ltd ( FOHE.NS ), the target of two rival takeover bids, has received an unsolicited offer from Chinese conglomerate Fosun International ( 0656.HK ) for an investment of up to $350 million. FILE PHOTO: A company logo of Fosun International is seen at the Fosun Fair held alongside the annual general meeting of the Chinese conglomerate in Hong Kong, China May 28, 2015. REUTERS/Bobby Yip/File Photo 
The offer is valued at 156 rupees ($2.38) per Fortis share, Fortis said on Tuesday. 
Malaysia’s IHH Healthcare Bhd ( IHHH.KL ) and India’s Manipal Health Enterprises Private Ltd are seeking to acquire Fortis. Reporting by Rama Venkat Raman in Bengaluru; Editing by Sai Sachin Ravikumar
